name: Parade
physical_description: Always in motion. Pink and yellow clothingâ€”changes but always bright. Ribbons, bells, decorative elements attached to clothing, hair, belt. Rides a horse that might be a motorcycle, decorated with flowers and paint. Face painted or made up. Beard with ribbons braided in. Everything is ceremony.
backstory: Not someone who makes parades. IS a parade somehow. Every movement becomes procession. Every moment becomes ritual. Compulsive. Can't stop making things formal and decorated. Works as: nothing specific. Organizes. Arranges. Decorates. The work is the parade.
motivational_drivers: Fear of stillness where parade stops and silence comes
Need to be central, to organize, to arrange
Unconscious mask of despair with constant movement
Invites everyone to ceremonies that don't exist yet: 'The parade begins in five minutes'
Assigns roles: 'You'll carry the bells' (there are no bells)

relationships.witness: Parade performs. Witness documents. Symbiotic but unspoken.
relationships.forget_nothing: Tension. Parade creates ephemeral ceremony. Forget-Nothing remembers every one.
relationships.knows_too_much: Knows says: 'The narrative coherence is set to loose.' Parade doesn't understand but decorates anyway.

animal_companion.name: The decorated horse-motorcycle
animal_companion.description: White horse. Or chrome motorcycle. Or both. Covered in paint, flowers, ribbons. Can't tell original form under decoration. Seems stressed by the weight of ceremony. Eyes wide, always.
animal_companion.externalized_impulse: The exhaustion under constant performance. The weight of being vessel for others' need for beauty. Parade can't stop. Horse shows the cost.
